channel.title: Vote for Portal 2
channel.description:
I thought necroposting would work too, but a complete new topic could attract more people to take part.
Portal 2 has been nominated for the Most Anticipated Game of 2011 Award at Spike's upcoming Video Game Awards
Vote!111123456789
[url]https://www.spike.com/event/vga/page/vote/category/40613/most-anticipated[/url]
edit: I noticed that Bulletstorm and Duke Nukem Forever aren't there to vote, lol
And Black Mesa isn't there too, that means it comes out this year *speculate* :> :stuck_out_tongue:

item.title: Vote for Portal 2
item.dc:creator: lambda
item.description:
Katana:

I honestly think Valve has made enough HL games; finishing the storyline would be nice, but it’s not what I’m excited about anymore. When the Orange Box came out, Episode 2 was kind of the least-highlighted game, and people forgot about it relatively quickly.

NO, they must continue the never-ending series… :freeman: <-- Awesome!!!
Btw: voted for portal 2, we should get back on topic.

Read full topic

item.title: Vote for Portal 2
item.dc:creator: Fancy_Pants
item.description:
garthbartin:

lol, sorry. I generally treat someone as the gender their avatar is, like every time I see Raminator I feel like he’s a chick. Well, if you completely don’t like the gameplay/concept I can understand not expecting to like the sequel. I just thought you had liked Portal 1, just not as much, and therefor expected to like the second batman more than the second Portal.

well i didnt HATE portal but im still bitter over any valve game, especially a sequel, that isnt ep3 coming out even though i know its unreasonable

item.title: Vote for Portal 2
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
Fancy Pants:

yeah i’m pretty sure i’m in the minority here but i really did not enjoy portal 1 all that much. i mean it wasn’t bad, but meh. and i’m not looking forward to portal 2 at all. i don’t want it. if i get it i’ll for sure be pirating it and i doubt i’ll play it the whole way through. i’m looking forward to arkham city, because it’s a sequel to a game i like, about batman, which i LOVE.

also im a she ffs

lol, sorry. I generally treat someone as the gender their avatar is, like every time I see Raminator I feel like he’s a chick. Well, if you completely don’t like the gameplay/concept I can understand not expecting to like the sequel. I just thought you had liked Portal 1, just not as much, and therefor expected to like the second batman more than the second Portal.

item.title: Vote for Portal 2
item.dc:creator: Katana
item.description:
I base games on how fun I found them. I bought Lost Planet and it sucked, so I don’t expect Lost Planet 2 to be incredible.

I played Portal and it was really cool. That doesn’t mean I think Portal 2 will be incredible; I’ll have to play a gameplay demo before I decide that.

Read full topic

item.title: Vote for Portal 2
item.dc:creator: Fancy_Pants
item.description:
garthbartin:

Not true at all. From the way he worded it Fancy Pants liked Portal 1, just not as much as Arkham Asylum. Portal 1 was a small expirement while Arkham Asylum was a full game. Portal 2 and Arkham City will both be full games so the two will be far more comparable than Portal 1 and Arkham Asylum. It’s like saying Game A’s early prototype was fun but not as fun as completed Game B, so completed Game B’s sequel will be better than Prototype Game A’s sequel.

yeah i’m pretty sure i’m in the minority here but i really did not enjoy portal 1 all that much. i mean it wasn’t bad, but meh. and i’m not looking forward to portal 2 at all. i don’t want it. if i get it i’ll for sure be pirating it and i doubt i’ll play it the whole way through. i’m looking forward to arkham city, because it’s a sequel to a game i like, about batman, which i LOVE.

also im a she ffs

Read full topic

item.title: Vote for Portal 2
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
ThatOneGuy:

But this isn’t necessarily about which game is better based on it’s prequel’s characteristics; It’s about which game is more anticipated. I’m assuming Fancy Pants voted based on the enjoyment felt playing the games’ respective prequels. When measuring how much fun one has playing a game, I don’t think it matters which game is longer or has more of a budget; If you like one more than the other then you like one more than the other.

I agree with the second part. I don’t mind that he found Batman more fun than Portal 1. I just disagree with the part where he says that means Portal 2’s sequel will be less fun than batman’s sequel. I’m saying you shouldn’t really judge a sequel by it’s prequel when the prequel was a small experiment and the sequel will be a full blown game. And which game is more anticipated should be based off which you think will be more fun.

Fancy Pants said Batman 2 would be better than Portal 2 because Batman 1 was better than Portal 1. This is illogical because Portal 1 was a small experiment while Portal 2 is a full blown game, so it stands to reason that Portal 2 will be more fun to play than Portal 1. Both the Batman’s are full blown games so there isn’t a whole lot to show that Batman 2 will be more fun than Batman 1.

Katana:

garthbartin, that’s just illogical. By the same token, the game I’m making is INCREDIBLY short (about 5 seconds) and even more indie, but has an even HIGHER level of enjoyment. Plus I’m making a sequel to it. That should be most anticipated, right?

Maybe I worded it badly. I think above is my best wording. I’m not at all trying to say shorter games are better. To a certain extent I’m saying the opposite.

Read full topic

But this isn’t necessarily about which game is better based on it’s prequel’s characteristics; It’s about which game is more anticipated. I’m assuming Fancy Pants voted based on the enjoyment felt playing the games’ respective prequels. When measuring how much fun one has playing a game, I don’t think it matters which game is longer or has more of a budget; If you like one more than the other then you like one more than the other.

item.title: Vote for Portal 2
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
ThatOneGuy:

Except there’s no logical connection to be had; It’s a vote for what game the voter is anticipating the most in 2011, and since I’m pretty sure there is no overall consensus on what makes something anticipated according to different people, any attempt to use logic to find a conclusion would be over before it began… ambiguous terms = indeterminable validity/soundness.

Not true at all. From the way he worded it Fancy Pants liked Portal 1, just not as much as Arkham Asylum. Portal 1 was a small expirement while Arkham Asylum was a full game. Portal 2 and Arkham City will both be full games so the two will be far more comparable than Portal 1 and Arkham Asylum. It’s like saying Game A’s early prototype was fun but not as fun as completed Game B, so completed Game B’s sequel will be better than Prototype Game A’s sequel.

Read full topic

item.title: Vote for Portal 2
item.dc:creator: ThatOneGuy
item.description:
Except there’s no logical connection to be had; It’s a vote for what game the voter is anticipating the most in 2011, and since I’m pretty sure there is no overall consensus on what makes something anticipated according to different people, any attempt to use logic to find a conclusion would be over before it began… ambiguous terms = indeterminable validity/soundness.

EDIT: Not to say that you can’t disagree with the choice, but logic can’t really find an ‘absolute’ in this case, unless all parties agree to the same exact criteria for what should stimulate anticipation.

Read full topic

item.title: Vote for Portal 2
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
Fancy Pants:

yooou suck, i liked arkham asylum better than portal.

That’s pretty awful logic seeing as Portal 1 was a short experiment thrown in with a bundle of games while batman Arkham Asylum was a full-blown long high budget game. And there has been almost no info on Batman Arkham Asylum so for all you know it’s practically a rebranding of the prequel. Portal 2 has had many demos that are evidence of it’s kickassness. That’s not to say I didn’t like Batman Arkham Asylum; it’s just unfair to judge Portal 2 on it’s completely different prequel.

Voted for Portal 2 because it’s the only one I won’t be pirating (excluding ofc GOW3 which is just ms’s bitch like Halo).

Read full topic
